text: Which statement best describes supervised learning?
options: Training without labels by finding structure in data
Training on labeled input–output examples to learn a mapping
Learning by trial-and-error using rewards and penalties
Hard-coding if/else rules written by an engineer
correct_answer: Training a model on labeled input–output examples to learn a mapping.
explanation: In supervised learning, labels (targets) guide optimization; the model learns to predict outputs from inputs.
